meanings.definition: To gush or shoot out in a stream
meanings.sent1: The water was spirting out of the broken pipe.
meanings.sent2: The fountain was spirting water into the air.
meanings.sent3: The juice box started spirting its contents when squeezed too hard.
meanings.sent4: The volcano was spirting lava high into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The fire hydrant was spirting water all over the street.

meanings.definition: A sudden gush or spurt of liquid
meanings.sent1: The spirting of oil from the well was unexpected.
meanings.sent2: The soda can made a loud noise when spirting its contents.
meanings.sent3: The ketchup bottle had a spirting mishap at the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The burst pipe caused a spirting of water in the basement.
meanings.sent5: The spirting of champagne marked the celebration.

meanings.definition: To flow or move in a rapid and forceful manner
meanings.sent1: The cars were spirting down the highway.
meanings.sent2: The river was spirting through the canyon.
meanings.sent3: The children were spirting around the playground with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The wind was spirting through the trees on a stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was spirting towards the finish line.
